job_description: Avigilon Corporation is defining the future of protection through innovative end-to-end security solutions.  Avigilon’s industry-leading HD network video management software, megapixel cameras, access control and video analytics products are reinventing the global security market.Avigilon's solutions protect and monitor thousands of customer sites in more than 100 countries around the world. Avigilon Control Center, an award-winning HD Network Video Management Software platform, a broad range of industry leading megapixel cameras (1-29 MP), open platform access control systems and video analytic solutions, deliver full situational awareness together with unmatched image detail. Campuses, transportation systems, healthcare providers, cities, retailers, and manufacturing sites are just a few of the complex business operations that benefit from the delivery of indisputable video evidence.In 2013, Avigilon was the fastest growing company in Canada on the PROFIT 500. The Company was also named Cantech's Stock of the Year (TSX), as voted by Canada's top financial analysts. The previous year saw Avigilon named the Fastest Growing Technology Company in Canada, the Fastest Growing Software Company in North America for the second year in a row, and the 'Company of the Year' by the BC Technology Industry Association.The successful candidate would be responsible for maintaining our surveillance software and camera documentation. They would be working with engineering and product management to gain technical insight into all of the new products, and will be working with the marketing and sales department to convey the technical knowledge into a well branded portfolio.We are looking for someone who is passionate about language and driven to learn about new technology to successfully assist in the day-to-day development of our documentation.Responsibilities include:• Working with MadCap Flare to create and maintain written content• Use Lingo to manage our translated assets.• Maintaining our graphics to meet our content standards• Use Adobe Creative Suite to develop and maintain technical marketing content• Troubleshooting potential issues with the CMS system• Helping create and edit documentation for new products• Helping further automate current processes, such as localized screenshot and overall localization process.Follow and learn more about Avigilon at:Website: avigilon.comFacebook: facebook.com/avigiloncorporationTwitter: twitter.com/avigilonYouTube: youtube.com/user/avigilon
job_requirements: Qualifications:• Excellent Communication Skills• Must be able to work independently• Not afraid of asking questions• Excited about working on multiple projects simultaneously• Must have a love of languages and details• Must demonstrate the ability to understand and document technical and engineering conceptsCandidate Assets:• Familiar with Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, InDesign, Illustrator)• Some experience working with HTML and XML• Some experience working with Content Management Systems (Subversion SVN)• Familiar with software development lifecycles• Multi-lingual in French, Spanish, German, Italian, Brazilian Portuguese, Russian or Chinese would be an asset but not required• Some experience in software programmingOpen To All Majors:No
